intro: Struthanthus taubatensis, commonly known as the Taubaté nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom at night, attracting specific pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories or on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
